It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with a distinct white margin. It produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically arranged in spikes. Parablechnum marginatum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
